contents:
Per curiam.
The entries in the ledger, supported by the oath of the clerk who made them, might be read as a link in the transaction, and part of the res gestee, to prove that Lewis¿ having negotiated the note, had received value for it. He was called, in an action by his endorsee, to prove want of consideration; and no case could be more distinctly within the rule in Walton v. Shelly.
Judgment affirmed.
